PAD_Moonshield.synopsis: VB played on the first time the players reach the Moonshield on the Haven bridge. They comment on how it holding back the shodows.
PAD_Moonshield.how_to_trigger: go to 3, 29, 110 in SCL_Main_A and then enter the moonshield half way across the birdge.

TadpoleCheckpoint.synopsis: The main dialog for the Tadpole Checkpoint event. Triggered either by simply entering Haven, or being caught sneaking inside.Jaheira tests us to see if we carry a tadpole - and must be convinced to let us enter once she discovers we do. Mol and Marcus vouching for the player is aliased across both states of the player being entangled and free from vines.
TadpoleCheckpoint.how_to_trigger: Various approaches - entering haven openly, sneaking in, arriving with our without Harper escort. All are routed to the barricade checkpoint where this dialogue takes place.To test in editor use the follow recon command to setup:oe havchec

PAD_Halsin.synopsis: Voicebark for Halsin on Entering Last Light. He has some history with the place (and the region in general)
PAD_Halsin.how_to_trigger: Recruit Halsin, cross the bridge in to Haven

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Analyzing the sessions’ synopses and trigger conditions reveals a natural flow through the Haven area. The PAD_Moonshield session is triggered when first reaching the Moonshield on the Haven bridge – an event that happens on the approach to Haven. The TadpoleCheckpoint session then occurs upon entry into Haven (whether entering openly or sneaking in). Finally, the PAD_Halsin session is triggered when, having recruited Halsin, the players cross the bridge to enter Haven (specifically entering the Last Light area). Thus, if a player experiences all these sessions, they would naturally occur in this order: first PAD_Moonshield, then TadpoleCheckpoint, and afterward PAD_Halsin. None of these sessions are mutually exclusive – rather, depending on the player’s choices (for example, whether Halsin is recruited), some sessions might not be triggered, but if triggered they follow this sequential relationship.

PAD_Moonshield_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Moonshield_0.text: No shadows here - something must be keeping it at bay.

TadpoleCheckpoint_4.speaker: Narrator
TadpoleCheckpoint_4.text: *The guard insists that you meet with their leader - a Harper by the name of Jaheira.*
TadpoleCheckpoint_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) We follow the Harper past other Harpers that eye us with suspicion. Soon they spot the person they're looking for and calls out to her: |InternalNodeContext: Player was sneaking inside but was discovered by someone. Jaheira was called in crime dialog.

TadpoleCheckpoint_86.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_86.context: InternalNodeContext: Dialogue was interrupted after someone vouched for the player, but before the question of how they got access was fully resolved.

TadpoleCheckpoint_87.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_87.context: InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed, but player counterspelled his summon.

TadpoleCheckpoint_188.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_188.text: Be on the alert, Harpers! We haven't seen the last of Marcus yet.
TadpoleCheckpoint_188.context: NodeContext: a martial order to her squad, who are shaken by witnessing a hideous transformation

TadpoleCheckpoint_54.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_54.text: As for you - you exposed a True Soul in our midst. You're no puppet of the Absolute, are you?
TadpoleCheckpoint_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: turns to player, speaking more quietlyNodeContext: Looks at us anew. Still suspicious, but intrigued too.

TadpoleCheckpoint_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The player takes Orpheus from their pocket and presents it to Jaheira who looks on intrigued. There’s a crackle of energy and she reacts to something in her pocket. She takes out the jar again and we see the tadpole flail wildly inside - then the jar explodes and the tadpole drops to the ground dead. There are gasps from the crowd, and several of the Harpers move in to strike us down. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_66.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_66.text: What in the hells is that thing?

TadpoleCheckpoint_51.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_51.text: Tell Jaheira everything you know about the artefact.

TadpoleCheckpoint_136.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_136.text: Congratulations. You've earned yourself the benefit of the doubt.

TadpoleCheckpoint_52.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_52.text: Hear me, Harpers! All clear, at ease!

TadpoleCheckpoint_175.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Those Harpers who still had their weapons drawn stow them way. The tension among them dissipates now that Jaheira has cleared us. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_245.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_245.text: I'll not pretend to understand what that artefact is, but I'm old and wise enough to recognise a sliver of hope when it crawls out of the dark.

TadpoleCheckpoint_242.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_242.text: Tell me - why have you come here?

TadpoleCheckpoint_259.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_259.text: To destroy the Absolute in its lair: Moonrise Towers.

TadpoleCheckpoint_257.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_257.text: Then you've found an ally in me, for that is precisely why I am here.

TadpoleCheckpoint_267.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_267.text: To pursue vengeance against the cult of the Absolute.

TadpoleCheckpoint_158.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_158.text: I just want a cure for the parasite in my head. Moonrise Towers is my only lead.

TadpoleCheckpoint_7.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_7.text: Then our interests align. We must all cure ourselves - of the entire cult of the Absolute.

TadpoleCheckpoint_239.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_239.text: There's food in the inn over there. Beds too if you require rest. Aloe oil in the cupboard in case the vines gave you a rash.

TadpoleCheckpoint_5.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_5.text: Settle in, then come join me for a drink. You may just be the godsend we've been praying for.

TadpoleCheckpoint_48.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_48.text: You're just in time for happy hour.

TadpoleCheckpoint_82.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_82.text: Not anymore. Not with so much at stake.

TadpoleCheckpoint_132.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_132.text: This land is afflicted - rotten. I am here to restore nature's will.

TadpoleCheckpoint_250.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_250.text: I'll not pretend to understand why you, the enigma that you are, suddenly crossed our path, but I'm old and wise enough to recognise a sliver of hope when it crawls out of the dark.

TadpoleCheckpoint_25.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_25.text: So far it's been a life-saver. Here's hoping you agree.

TadpoleCheckpoint_131.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_131.text: Your guess is as good as mine.

TadpoleCheckpoint_137.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_137.text: Strangest magic I've seen since roaming the ruins of Myth Drannor, but I can't argue with the results.

TadpoleCheckpoint_133.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_133.context: NodeContext: Responding to the player's 'I work in mysterious ways.'  losing patience

TadpoleCheckpoint_85.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_85.text: You'll just have to take my word for it.

TadpoleCheckpoint_224.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_224.text: You sound so confident for someone who's so wrong.
TadpoleCheckpoint_224.context: NodeContext: tension - losing patience, with an edge.

TadpoleCheckpoint_251.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_251.text: I know it's hard to trust anyone right now, but believe me: I am not an Absolute cultist.

TadpoleCheckpoint_128.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_128.text: I know it's hard to trust anyone right now, but believe me: I am not an Absolute cultist.

TadpoleCheckpoint_36.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_36.text: I routed your spy, didn't I?

TadpoleCheckpoint_207.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_207.text: I routed your spy, didn't I?

TadpoleCheckpoint_169.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_169.text: The Weave itself burns through my veins - perhaps the tadpole is afraid.

TadpoleCheckpoint_46.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_46.text: I've met no sorcerer that powerful - and I've met many. Now, speak plain - how do you have control?

TadpoleCheckpoint_160.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_160.text: I suspect this icosahedral artefact is involved. (Show Jaheira.)

TadpoleCheckpoint_129.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_129.text: Bah! Vile things that befit a vile traitor.
TadpoleCheckpoint_129.context: InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed and summoned claws, and the NPCs are reacting to this,

TadpoleCheckpoint_220.context: InternalNodeContext: | (CINE) We arrive at a place bathed in moonlight: a safe haven amid the shadows. Armed Harpers draw their weapons as we approach, and call out to us: |

TadpoleCheckpoint_198.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_198.text: You there! Step forward and keep your hands off your weapons!

TadpoleCheckpoint_67.speaker: Harper Karrow, Harper Lassandra, Harper Meygan
TadpoleCheckpoint_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking up from beside the player and stepping forward, speaking to Elifer

TadpoleCheckpoint_80.speaker: Harper Branthos, Harper Elindale, Harper Manus, Harper Skywin
TadpoleCheckpoint_80.text: Easy! They helped us out in the shadows.
TadpoleCheckpoint_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking up from beside the player and stepping forward, speaking to Elifer

TadpoleCheckpoint_151.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_151.text: I am Lae'zel. It is your pleasure to meet me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_248.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_248.text: Someone lost in the dark, drawn to the light here.

TadpoleCheckpoint_38.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_38.text: Who am I? Who in the hells are you?

TadpoleCheckpoint_145.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_145.text: I've come from Moonrise Towers - I just freed some prisoners there.

TadpoleCheckpoint_75.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_75.context: NodeContext: High tension - player has just approached the checkpoint and given a reason why they've come.

TadpoleCheckpoint_41.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_41.text: The name's [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. Jack of all trades, master of plenty. Charmed, I'm sure.

TadpoleCheckpoint_17.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_17.text: We'll see how charmed you are in a minute.

TadpoleCheckpoint_193.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_193.text: Just keep your hands where I can see them and follow me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_91.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_91.context: CinematicNodeContext:  (CINE) The Harper beckons us to follow. |NodeContext: To player, The Harper beckons us to follow

TadpoleCheckpoint_215.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_215.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) We follow the Harper past other Harpers that eye us with suspicion. Soon they spot the person they're looking for and calls out to her: |

TadpoleCheckpoint_213.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira approaches. Haper Elifer is about to speak, but a stern glance from Jaheira shuts them up and makes them cast her eyes to the ground. Jaheira then directs her stern glance at us. Without a word she raises her right hand claw-like to chest height. Magic ripples and entangling vines start to sprout from the ground, trapping the party in place. Onlooking Harpers draw their swords. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_40.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_40.text: Holy shit. It's really you. The Jaheira.

TadpoleCheckpoint_19.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_19.text: You have me at a disadvantage. Let me correct that.
TadpoleCheckpoint_19.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_6.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_6.text: Just this once, I wish people would simply say hello.

TadpoleCheckpoint_249.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_249.context: NodeContext: Unamused, not actually welcoming, but matter of fact. Menacing.

TadpoleCheckpoint_234.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_234.text: Please - ma'am - I'm from Baldur's Gate. Like you. I'm on your side.

TadpoleCheckpoint_172.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_172.text: I'll be the judge of that.

TadpoleCheckpoint_124.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_124.text: Easy. Give me a chance to earn your trust.

TadpoleCheckpoint_150.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_150.text: Please - I've already saved some people imprisoned by Absolute cultists. I'm here to help.

TadpoleCheckpoint_126.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_126.text: An act of kindness, or a clever decoy. Luckily, I know how to find out which.

TadpoleCheckpoint_148.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_148.text: I saved your soldiers and this is the thanks I get?

TadpoleCheckpoint_244.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_244.text: Kindness is too often a decoy.

TadpoleCheckpoint_84.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_84.text: Could you at least explain to me why you're doing this?

TadpoleCheckpoint_232.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_232.context: NodeContext: She says this knowingly - she suspects us to be part of the Absolute so she can say this with a lot of emphasis and double meaning.

TadpoleCheckpoint_11.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_11.text: Nervous? I've an inkling you've reason to be.

TadpoleCheckpoint_146.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_146.text: This is why we're here, you see.
TadpoleCheckpoint_146.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) With her free left hand, Jaheira fishes a jar out of her back pocket and hold it up for us to see. It contains a tadpole. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. She’s about to make a demonstration.

TadpoleCheckpoint_190.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_190.text: It is a curious creature that hides all manner of secrets. But if there's one thing that we know -
TadpoleCheckpoint_190.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira approaches with the jar outstretched - in it floats the tadpole, motionless and seemingly dead. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. She’s about to make a demonstration.

TadpoleCheckpoint_201.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_201.text: - it's that it knows its own kind.
TadpoleCheckpoint_201.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) As the jar nears our face, the tadpole suddenly LASHES TO LIFE, straining towards us through the glass. | 

| (CINE) Her suspicions now confirmed, Jaheira stows away the jar. The onlooking Harpers eye us with a mixture of fear and hatred. |NodeContext: Her calm menace continues. The demonstration is done and she’s proved her point: we’re the enemy because we have a tadpole in our heads.

TadpoleCheckpoint_64.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_64.text: You should never have come here, True Soul.
TadpoleCheckpoint_64.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) Jaheira raises her free left hand, signalling the surrounding Harpers, who ready their weapons  to attack |NodeContext: Grave. She’s passing a death sentence on us.

TadpoleCheckpoint_102.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_102.text: I am not... a True Soul...

TadpoleCheckpoint_47.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_47.text: Look to the Harpers you saved.

TadpoleCheckpoint_101.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_101.text: Stand down, or we'll put you down.
TadpoleCheckpoint_101.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player rages against the vines to snap them and succeeds. In response Jaheira reels back but then returns to a spell-casting pose, ready to kill the player - she still beleives them to be a True Soul. 
[greg reshoot] have her start casting Flaming Sphere between first and second line; more threatening please

TadpoleCheckpoint_253.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_253.text: I'm not interested in the Absolute's manipulations.

TadpoleCheckpoint_71.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_71.text: Harpers - cut this True Soul down.
TadpoleCheckpoint_71.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira holds her hand aloft, preparing to give the order to attack the playerNodeContext: Projected to her soldiers.

TadpoleCheckpoint_263.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_263.text: It'll hurt less if you hold still.
TadpoleCheckpoint_263.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player struggles against the vines trying to escape, but fails. Jaheira turns her hand, claw-like, again, in a further attempt to kill the player.

TadpoleCheckpoint_230.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_230.text: I mourn for whoever you were before the Absolute infected you.
TadpoleCheckpoint_230.context: NodeContext: Right Hand still claw-like trying to kill player.

TadpoleCheckpoint_15.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The focus remains on us and Jaheira. The shout comes from off-camera. |

| (CINE) Jaheira glances over as a small figure pushes through the Harpers. It's Mol. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_89.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_89.text: What are you doing? They're the ones that saved us!

TadpoleCheckpoint_100.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_100.text: They're the one who protected the Emerald Grove?

TadpoleCheckpoint_205.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_205.text: Yup. Didn't leave a goblin standing. Not so bad to hang around with either.

TadpoleCheckpoint_231.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_231.text: Saved two of my friends - one from a harpy, and one from a mad druid with a snake. Didn't make a fuss of our thieving, either.

TadpoleCheckpoint_3.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_3.text: Saved two of my friends - one from a harpy, and one from a mad druid with a snake.

TadpoleCheckpoint_223.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_223.text: I'd pretty much trust them with my life.

TadpoleCheckpoint_258.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_258.text: A True Soul with a mind of their own... How is that possible?

TadpoleCheckpoint_76.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_76.text: Plucked one of my friends out of a harpy's talons. Knows when to be discreet, too.

TadpoleCheckpoint_154.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_154.text: Saved one of my friends from a druid with a snake. Knows when to be discreet, too.

TadpoleCheckpoint_110.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_110.text: Plucked my friend right out of a harpy's talons.
TadpoleCheckpoint_110.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

TadpoleCheckpoint_209.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_209.text: Saved us from a mad druid and her snakes. A real class act.
TadpoleCheckpoint_209.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

TadpoleCheckpoint_180.speaker: Mol
TadpoleCheckpoint_180.text: Even caught us thieving and didn't make a thing of it.
TadpoleCheckpoint_180.context: NodeContext: Neutral - recounting the ways we helped her. Line could be one of a number in succession, so delivery should be without too much emotion. (Mol could play this as bored)

TadpoleCheckpoint_37.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_37.context:
CinematicNodeContext: | (CINE) The focus remains on us and Jaheira. The shout comes from off-camera. |

| (CINE) Jaheira glances over as a Flaming Fist soldier pushes through the Harpers. It's Marcus. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_177.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_177.text: Hold on, Jaheira. I think I know this one.
TadpoleCheckpoint_177.context: NodeContext: Marcus is a spy, butting in to save us.

TadpoleCheckpoint_93.speaker: Narrator
TadpoleCheckpoint_93.text: *His eyes meet yours. There's no recognition there - just a sick intensity as his voice reverberates in your mind.*

TadpoleCheckpoint_44.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_44.text: If you want to survive this, then trust me - one True Soul to another.
TadpoleCheckpoint_44.context: NodeContext: Urging us to play along

TadpoleCheckpoint_186.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_186.text: They're infected, aye - but they're not with the cultists. Helped me fight them off a while back, in fact.
TadpoleCheckpoint_186.context: NodeContext: Speaking warmly of us, a lie to convince Jaheira to trust us.

TadpoleCheckpoint_27.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_27.context: NodeContext: to player, surprised but wary that you've been given a reason to trust them

TadpoleCheckpoint_144.context: CinematicNodeContext: She lowers her hand before speaking, and the vines on the player fall away.NodeContext: you have this person surrounded with your troops - 'Harpers' - and you're asking them to explain themselves quickly

TadpoleCheckpoint_63.speaker: Lae'zel
TadpoleCheckpoint_63.text: If the True Soul wants to help, so be it. We're in no state to refuse.

TadpoleCheckpoint_217.speaker: Astarion
TadpoleCheckpoint_217.text: Don't do anything stupid - just say he's right and get us out of this!

TadpoleCheckpoint_165.speaker: Gale
TadpoleCheckpoint_165.text: Might as well take part in this Absolute charade if that buys us both time and our lives.

TadpoleCheckpoint_96.speaker: Wyll
TadpoleCheckpoint_96.text: Play along with the Fist. We can deal with him later.

TadpoleCheckpoint_135.speaker: Shadowheart
TadpoleCheckpoint_135.text: That tadpoled Fist thinks we're his allies. No need to correct him just yet, if he can help us.

TadpoleCheckpoint_29.speaker: Karlach
TadpoleCheckpoint_29.text: A True Soul! Play along for the minute - we can kick his arse afterward.

TadpoleCheckpoint_2.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_2.text: He's right. I was enslaved by the cult and served them once, but I'm free of them now.

TadpoleCheckpoint_241.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_241.text: He's right. Mind flayers infected me, but they don't control me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_164.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_164.text: You haven't tested him, have you? He's infected too.

TadpoleCheckpoint_106.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_106.context: NodeContext: Utterly shocked - he thinks we're on the same side and we've just outed him as a spy, getting us both in trouble

TadpoleCheckpoint_26.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_26.text: Marcus? He's been with us from the beginning. Since...
TadpoleCheckpoint_26.context: NodeContext: About to dismiss our claim, then thinks about it

TadpoleCheckpoint_176.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_176.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at MarcusNodeContext: Pointed question

TadpoleCheckpoint_116.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_116.text: Jaheira, come now. This one's parasite has dug a little too deep, eh?

TadpoleCheckpoint_204.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_204.context: CinematicNodeContext: | (Cine) Jaheira takes out the jar and holds it in Marcus’ direction. The tadpole flails as madly as it did when she did the same to us. The crowd gasps. |

TadpoleCheckpoint_265.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_265.context: NodeContext: calm, despite being suddenly exposed and surrounded by enemies on all sides

TadpoleCheckpoint_95.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_95.text: The Absolute has given me many gifts already. She'll give me so much more when all of you are dead.
TadpoleCheckpoint_95.context: CinematicNodeContext: |Large wings unfurl from Marcus' back, and the crowd back away in shock.|NodeContext: Uncannily and eerily calm despite being exposed as an enemy and surrounded on all sides

TadpoleCheckpoint_58.speaker: Fist Marcus
TadpoleCheckpoint_58.text: You, most of all, will suffer for this blasphemy. Your life is mine, but in death you will belong to the General.
TadpoleCheckpoint_58.context: CinematicNodeContext: mind-meld, looking player right in the eye, Marcus forms a triangular symbol with his hands.

TadpoleCheckpoint_10.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_10.text: Go quietly - it'll be easier for all of us.

TadpoleCheckpoint_216.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_216.text: Offer a prayer to your god for salvation.

TadpoleCheckpoint_21.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_21.text: A pathetic deception - I know who you really worship, True Soul.
TadpoleCheckpoint_21.context: NodeContext: angry, ready to kill the player

TadpoleCheckpoint_50.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_50.text: Beseech your patron to help you.

TadpoleCheckpoint_157.speaker: Narrator
TadpoleCheckpoint_157.text: *Your request falls deep into the nameless reaches of your patron's home plane. It seems to be met with deafening silence.*

TadpoleCheckpoint_105.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_105.text: A preposterous experiment - the tadpole could be reacting to anything. Let me GO!

TadpoleCheckpoint_211.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_211.text: Wizards... Always talking, never knowing when to be quiet.

TadpoleCheckpoint_8.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_8.text: Channel your rage. Pull apart these puny vines.

TadpoleCheckpoint_240.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_240.text: Force your own magic through vines, loosening them.

TadpoleCheckpoint_34.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_34.text: Force your own magic through the vines, weakening them.

TadpoleCheckpoint_167.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_167.text: Jaheira, is it? I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], and I assure you none of this is necessary.

TadpoleCheckpoint_78.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_78.text: Jaheira, is it? Like I told your guard, I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53], and I assure you none of this is necessary.

TadpoleCheckpoint_88.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_88.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_227.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_227.text: I have been named Faithwarden. I command you to release me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_184.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_184.text: Oh, but you ward something far more sinister than faith alone, don't you?

TadpoleCheckpoint_202.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_202.text: Call me Lae'zel, if you must call me at all. Now explain yourself.

TadpoleCheckpoint_225.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_225.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_191.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_191.text: I'm Shadowheart. I'd offer to shake your hand, but I'm in a spot of difficulty.

TadpoleCheckpoint_255.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_255.text: Rather more than a spot, actually.
TadpoleCheckpoint_255.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_229.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_229.text: The name's Astarion. And I rather dislike vines in uninvited places.

TadpoleCheckpoint_181.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_181.text: You won't have to like them very long.
TadpoleCheckpoint_181.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_9.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_9.text: I'm Gale, and I find myself only moderately pleased to meet you.

TadpoleCheckpoint_49.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_49.text: Ever so sorry to hear that.
TadpoleCheckpoint_49.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_61.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_61.text: I am Wyll, the Blade of Frontiers. Perhaps you've heard of me?

TadpoleCheckpoint_228.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_228.text: I heard the Blade of Frontiers was a hero, not a hellspawn.

TadpoleCheckpoint_33.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_33.context: NodeContext: She tightens her raised left hand for a beat as the vines constrict

TadpoleCheckpoint_166.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_166.text: You have to the count of five to let me go.

TadpoleCheckpoint_260.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_260.text: A count to five is all I need.

TadpoleCheckpoint_247.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_247.text: Usually I'm not the one in the snare - mind releasing me?

TadpoleCheckpoint_99.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_99.text: If I have to rip these vines apart, I will. And then I'll do the same to you.

TadpoleCheckpoint_117.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_117.text: You're the Jaheira? I have heard of you, Friend of the Forest.

TadpoleCheckpoint_163.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_163.text: Something like that. Did you hear that I saved your soldiers?

TadpoleCheckpoint_77.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_77.text: Care to explain why a legendary druid has one of her own wrapped in vines?

TadpoleCheckpoint_182.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_182.text: I heard you were strong - smart. Seems I heard wrong.

TadpoleCheckpoint_162.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_162.text: How uncouth. Legends led me to expect better of the noble Jaheira.

TadpoleCheckpoint_194.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_194.text: It seems tales of my clemency have been greatly exaggerated.

TadpoleCheckpoint_60.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_60.text: At least give me a chance to earn your trust.

TadpoleCheckpoint_155.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_155.text: So it would seem. Did you hear that I saved your soldiers?

TadpoleCheckpoint_115.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_115.text: If you let me go, I'll happily amend the tales. Add a 'hates strangers' footnote.

TadpoleCheckpoint_238.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_238.text: You have not experienced my hatred, stranger. Not yet, at least.

TadpoleCheckpoint_159.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_159.text: If this is supposed to scare me, it won't work - monks are not so easily cowed.

TadpoleCheckpoint_55.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_55.text: A level head. Let us see if you will get to keep it.
TadpoleCheckpoint_55.context: NodeContext: Amused, approving of our courage in pushing back on her - but not to be swayed

TadpoleCheckpoint_83.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_83.text: At ease, Jaheira - I am no threat. I am bound by oath not to harm the innocent.

TadpoleCheckpoint_18.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_18.text: Hah! Well I am certainly no innocent, paladin - so I'll bind you with vines a moment longer, if you do not mind.
TadpoleCheckpoint_18.context: NodeContext: Snort of amusement at player's high-handed attempt tell reassure her they don't 'harm the innocent'.

TadpoleCheckpoint_35.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_35.text: I am magic incarnate - these vines will not hold me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_183.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_183.context: NodeContext: Wry, amused at us calling ourselves 'magic incarnate'. Deadpan and dry more than mocking - she's moving on to her actual business - testing us for a tadpole

TadpoleCheckpoint_39.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_39.text: Fascinating - both your command of magic and its technical implementation are impeccable.

TadpoleCheckpoint_156.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_156.text: A good start - but you've told me something I already know. Tell me something I don't.
TadpoleCheckpoint_156.context: NodeContext: Dryly amused at our attempts to compliment her, but not to be swayed - moving immediately onto the business of checking us for tadpoles

TadpoleCheckpoint_74.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_74.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I fight with the strength of ten warriors - do not trifle with me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_70.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_70.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am a druid - a servant of nature's will.

TadpoleCheckpoint_192.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_192.text: A fellow druid? She will want to meet you.
TadpoleCheckpoint_192.context: NodeContext: surprise, but still a hint of suspicion ('she' is Jaheira)

TadpoleCheckpoint_214.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_214.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am a monk, here on a pilgrimage.

TadpoleCheckpoint_189.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_189.text: You picked a strange place to meditate, monk.

TadpoleCheckpoint_79.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_79.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I am but a humble cleric.

TadpoleCheckpoint_118.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_118.text: A cleric? You'll find no quarter here - for you, or the one you serve.

TadpoleCheckpoint_119.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_119.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to protect the innocent and fight for justice - I mean no harm.

TadpoleCheckpoint_22.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_22.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to protect nature, and her creatures, from evil. I mean you no harm.

TadpoleCheckpoint_81.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_81.text: A paladin? She will want to meet you.
TadpoleCheckpoint_81.context: NodeContext: surprise, but still a hint of suspicion ('she' is Jaheira)

TadpoleCheckpoint_103.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_103.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I've sworn an oath to deliver justice at any cost. Unless you harm another, you are safe from me.

TadpoleCheckpoint_16.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_16.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I walk my own path, and mean you no harm - for now.

TadpoleCheckpoint_147.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_147.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - a master of magic, and the secrets it holds.

TadpoleCheckpoint_104.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_104.text: No doubt a wizard has opinions on this darkness - she will want to meet you.

TadpoleCheckpoint_212.speaker: Player
TadpoleCheckpoint_212.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53] - a sorcerer, at your service.

TadpoleCheckpoint_179.speaker: Harper Elifer
TadpoleCheckpoint_179.text: Hm. Convenient that a sorcerer would emerge from the darkness, of all places.

TadpoleCheckpoint_236.speaker: Jaheira
TadpoleCheckpoint_236.text: There you are! I thought those vile claws dragged you into a terrible grave.
TadpoleCheckpoint_236.context:
InternalNodeContext: Marcus transformed and summoned claws, and the NPCs are reacting to this,
The player was outside of dialogue range for a minute, so they're also reacting to that.

PAD_Halsin_1.speaker: Halsin
PAD_Halsin_1.text: Last Light Inn... we rallied here once, years ago, before the assault on Moonrise Towers.
PAD_Halsin_1.context: NodeContext: Faintly bittersweet reminiscence. Enrtering a place he passed through 100 years ago.

PAD_Halsin_0.speaker: Halsin
PAD_Halsin_0.text: The Archdruid at the time spoke to us all, inspiring our courage... he was a fine leader.
PAD_Halsin_0.context: NodeContext: Wondering how he himself measures up as Archdruid in comparison, perhaps.
